Imaging Review: CT Chest with IV Contrast
Clinical History: Lung mass, no further information

Technical Data: 120kVp, 100 effective mAs, 2x2.5mm slices, 0.6mm increment, 25cm FOV, 512 matrix, 140 kU exposure
Imaging Findings:
Lungs: No acute pulmonary embolism. No pleural effusions. No focal consolidation. No significant interstitial lung disease. No significant bronchiectasis. No significant mediastinal or hilar lymphadenopathy. No pleural plaques.
Bone Marrow: There is an ill-defined area of low attenuation within the right T9 vertebral body, without associated soft tissue mass or extraosseous extension. No significant vertebral body collapse.
Liver: There is a 4.7 cm well-circumscribed low-attenuation lesion in segment 7 without significant enhancement. There is no biliary ductal dilatation. The remainder of the liver appears unremarkable.
Kidneys: Normal in size and appearance without significant renovascular disease.
Adenopathy: No significant adenopathy.
Other: No significant findings.

Impression:
1.  Non-enhancing low-attenuation lesion in segment 7 of the liver, most likely a benign cyst.
2.  Ill-defined low-attenuation area within the right T9 vertebral body, could represent a benign lesion such as a bone island or cyst. No evidence of significant vertebral body collapse.
3.  No acute pulmonary embolism.
""" Give two different responses. Responses and only responses should be separated by 6 asterisk symbols: ******.

In the lumbar spine there is marked canal stenosis with severe foraminal narrowing. There is a retrolisthesis of L4 on L5. There is a retrolisthesis of L5 on S1. There is moderate degenerative disc disease. The L4-L5 disc is protruding causing severe narrowing of the left lateral recess and moderate narrowing of the right lateral recess. There is a small left paracentral disc protrusion at L4-L5 causing moderate narrowing of the left lateral recess. The L5-S1 disc is protruding causing severe narrowing of the left lateral recess and moderate narrowing of the right lateral recess. There is a small left paracentral disc protrusion at L5-S1 causing moderate narrowing of the left lateral recess. There is a right foraminal disc protrusion at L4-L5 causing severe narrowing of the right lateral recess. There is a right foraminal disc protrusion at L5-S1 causing moderate narrowing of the right lateral recess. There is a retrolisthesis of L4 on L5. There is a retrolisthesis of L5 on S1. There is mild spondylolisthesis of L4 on L5. There is spondylolisthesis of L5 on S1. The disc heights are maintained.

Bone marrow signal is increased on T2 weighted images. There is no marrow expansion. There is no soft tissue edema.

The vertebral bodies are normal. There is no acute fracture. There is no subluxation. There is no infection. The discs are desiccated. There is no acute discitis. There is no osteophyte formation. The end plates are intact. The ligamentum flavum is thickened. There is no epidural fluid collection. There is no subarachnoid fluid collection.

The aorta and IVC appear normal.

Impression:
Severe lumbar spinal stenosis with retrolistheses and spondylolisthesis. There is no acute fracture. The bone marrow signal is increased on T2 weighted images without marrow expansion. This is not specific for any particular etiology. Clinical correlation is recommended.
"""
